Explain how to shield a coinbase transaction using the `z_shieldcoinbase` command in Verus, and how to view detailed shielded information about a transaction using the `z_viewtransaction` command?

In Verus, you can shield a coinbase transaction using the `z_shieldcoinbase` command. This command takes two arguments: the coinbase transaction ID and the shielded wallet address. Here's an example of how to use this command in the Verus command-line interface:
```bash
verus z_shieldcoinbase "RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV" "ztfaW34Gj9FrnGUEf833ywDVL62NWXBM81u6EQnM6VR45eYnXhwztecW1SjxA7JrmAXKJhxhj3vDNEpVCQoSvVoSpmbhtjf"
```
Alternatively, you can use the Verus JSON-RPC API to shield a coinbase transaction. Here's an example of how to use the `z_shieldcoinbase` method with `curl`:
```bash
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_shieldcoinbase", "params": ["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV", "ztfaW34Gj9FrnGUEf833ywDVL62NWXBM81u6EQnM6VR45eYnXhwztecW1SjxA7JrmAXKJhxhj3vDNEpVCQoSvVoSpmbhtjf"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Once you have shielded a coinbase transaction, you can view detailed shielded information about the transaction using the `z_viewtransaction` command. This command takes a single argument: the transaction ID. Here's an example of how to use this command:
```bash
verus z_viewtransaction "txid"
```
The `z_viewtransaction` command returns a JSON object containing detailed information about the transaction, including the transaction ID, spends, and outputs. Here's an example of what the output might look like:
```json
{
  "txid" : "transactionid",
  "spends" : [
    {
      "type" : "sprout|sapling",
      "js" : n,
      "jsSpend" : n,
      "spend" : n,
      "txidPrev" : "transactionid",
      "jsPrev" : n,
      "jsOutputPrev" : n,
      "outputPrev" : n,
      "address" : "zcashaddress",
      "value" : x.xxx,
      "valueZat" : xxxx
    },
   ...
  ],
  "outputs" : [
    {
      "type" : "sprout|sapling",
     ...
    },
   ...
  ]
}
```
The `z_viewtransaction` command provides a way to view detailed information about shielded transactions in Verus, which can be useful for debugging and testing purposes.

Examples:
```bash
> verus z_shieldcoinbase "RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV" "ztfaW34Gj9FrnGUEf833ywDVL62NWXBM81u6EQnM6VR45eYnXhwztecW1SjxA7JrmAXKJhxhj3vDNEpVCQoSvVoSpmbhtjf"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_shieldcoinbase", "params": ["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV", "ztfaW34Gj9FrnGUEf833ywDVL62NWXBM81u6EQnM6VR45eYnXhwztecW1SjxA7JrmAXKJhxhj3vDNEpVCQoSvVoSpmbhtjf"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `z_viewtransaction "txid"`
Get detailed shielded information about in-wallet transaction <txid>#### Arguments:
1. "txid" (string, required) The transaction id#### Result:
```json
{
 "txid" : "transactionid",  (string) The transaction id
 "spends" : [
  {
   "type" : "sprout|sapling",   (string) The type of address
   "js" : n,            (numeric, sprout) the index of the JSDescription within vJoinSplit
   "jsSpend" : n,         (numeric, sprout) the index of the spend within the JSDescription
   "spend" : n,          (numeric, sapling) the index of the spend within vShieldedSpend
   "txidPrev" : "transactionid",  (string) The id for the transaction this note was created in
   "jsPrev" : n,          (numeric, sprout) the index of the JSDescription within vJoinSplit
   "jsOutputPrev" : n,       (numeric, sprout) the index of the output within the JSDescription
   "outputPrev" : n,        (numeric, sapling) the index of the output within the vShieldedOutput
   "address" : "zcashaddress",   (string) The Zcash address involved in the transaction
   "value" : x.xxx         (numeric) The amount in VRSC
   "valueZat" : xxxx        (numeric) The amount in zatoshis
  }
  ,...
 ],
 "outputs" : [
  {
   "type" : "sprout|sapling",   (string) The type of address
   "js" :
